nfs_main.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00093 #include "nfs_init.h"
00094 #include "fsal.h"

00098 #include <signal.h> /* for sigaction */

00102 /* parameters for NFSd startup and default values */
00103 
00104 nfs_start_info_t    my_nfs_start_info =
00105 {
00106    .flush_datacache_mode = FALSE,
00107    .nb_flush_threads     = 1,
00108    .flush_behaviour      = CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE,
00109    .lw_mark_trigger      = FALSE
00110 };
00111 
00112 char my_config_path[MAXPATHLEN] = "/etc/ganesha/ganesha.conf";
00113 char log_path[MAXPATHLEN]    = "/tmp/nfs-ganesha.log";
00114 char exec_name[MAXPATHLEN]   = "nfs-ganesha";
00115 char host_name[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] = "localhost";
00116 int          debug_level       = NIV_EVENT;
00117 int          detach_flag       = FALSE ;
00118 char ganesha_exec_path[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00119 
00120 
00121 
00122 /* command line syntax */
00123 
00124 char  options[] = "h@RdS:F:S:P:f:L:N:" ;
00125 char  usage[] = 
00126     "Usage: %s [-hd][-L <logfile>][-N <dbg_lvl>][-f <config_file>]\n"
00127     "\t[-h]                display this help\n"
00128     "\t[-L <logfile>]      set the default logfile for the daemon\n"
00129     "\t[-N <dbg_lvl>]      set the verbosity level\n"
00130     "\t[-f <config_file>]  set the config file to be used\n"
00131     "\t[-d]                the daemon starts in background, in a new process group\n"
00132     "\t[-R]                daemon will manage RPCSEC_GSS (default is no RPCSEC_GSS)\n"
00133     "\t[-F] <nb_flushers>  flushes the data cache with purge, but do not answer to requests\n"
00134     "\t[-S] <nb_flushers>  flushes the data cache without purge, but do not answer to requests\n"
00135     "\t[-P] <nb_flushers>  flushes the data cache with purge until lw mark is reached, then just sync. Do not answer to requests\n"
00136     "----------------- Signals ----------------\n"
00137     "SIGUSR1    : Enable/Disable File Content Cache forced flush\n" 
00138     "SIGTERM    : Cleanly terminate the program\n" 
00139     "------------- Default Values -------------\n"
00140     "LogFile    : /tmp/nfs-ganesha.log\n"
00141     "DebugLevel : NIV_EVENT\n"
00142     "ConfigFile : /etc/ganesha/ganesha.conf\n" ;
00143 
00150 static void action_sigusr1( int sig )
00151 {
00152  DisplayLog( "SIGUSR1_HANDLER: Receveid SIGUSR1.... signal will be managed" ) ;
00153  
00154   /* Set variable force_flush_by_signal that is used in file content cache gc thread */
00155   if( force_flush_by_signal )
00156     {
00157         DisplayLog( "SIGUSR1_HANDLER: force_flush_by_signal is set to FALSE" ) ;
00158         force_flush_by_signal = FALSE ;
00159     }
00160   else
00161     {
00162         DisplayLog( "SIGUSR1_HANDLER: force_flush_by_signal is set to TRUE" ) ;
00163         force_flush_by_signal = TRUE ;
00164     }
00165 } /* action_sigusr1 */
00166 
00173 static void action_sigterm( int sig )
00174 {
00175     if ( sig == SIGTERM )
00176       DisplayLog( "SIGTERM_HANDLER: Receveid SIGTERM.... initiating daemon shutdown" ) ;
00177     else if ( sig == SIGINT )
00178       DisplayLog( "SIGINT_HANDLER: Receveid SIGINT.... initiating daemon shutdown" ) ;
00179 
00180  nfs_stop();
00181   
00182 } /* action_sigterm */
00183    
00196 int main( int argc, char * argv[] )
00197 {
00198     char           * tempo_exec_name          = NULL ;
00199     char             localmachine[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
00200     int              c ;
00201     nfs_parameter_t  nfs_param;
00202     pid_t            son_pid ;
00203     struct sigaction act_sigusr1 ;
00204     struct sigaction act_sigterm ;
00205 
00206 
00207     /* retrieve executable file's name */
00208     strncpy( ganesha_exec_path, argv[0], MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00209  
00210     if( ( tempo_exec_name = strrchr( argv[0], '/' ) ) != NULL )
00211         strcpy( (char *)exec_name, tempo_exec_name + 1 ) ;
00212 
00213     if( *exec_name == '\0' )
00214         strcpy( (char *)exec_name, argv[0] ) ;
00215    
00216     
00217     /* get host name */
00218     
00219     if( gethostname( localmachine, sizeof( localmachine ) ) != 0 )
00220     {
00221         fprintf( stderr, "Could not get local host name, exiting..." ) ;
00222         exit( 1 ) ;
00223     }
00224     else
00225         strncpy( host_name, localmachine, MAXHOSTNAMELEN);
00226     
00227 
00228     /* now parsing options with getopt */
00229     while( ( c = getopt( argc, argv, options ) ) != EOF )
00230     {
00231       switch( c ) 
00232         {
00233         case '@':
00234           /* A litlle backdoor to keep track of binary versions */
00235           printf( "%s compiled on %s at %s\n", exec_name, __DATE__, __TIME__ ) ;
00236           printf( "Release = %s\n", VERSION ) ;
00237           printf( "Release comment = %s\n", VERSION_COMMENT ) ;
00238           exit( 0 ) ;
00239           break ;
00240 
00241         case 'L':
00242           /* Default Log */
00243           strncpy( log_path, optarg, MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00244           break ;
00245 
00246         case 'N':
00247           /* debug level */
00248           debug_level = ReturnLevelAscii( optarg );
00249           if ( debug_level == -1 )
00250           {
00251             fprintf( stderr, "Invalid value for option 'N': NIV_NULL, NIV_MAJ, NIV_CRIT, NIV_EVENT, NIV_DEBUG or NIV_FULL_DEBUG expected.\n" );
00252             exit(1);
00253           }
00254           break ;
00255 
00256         case 'f':
00257           /* config file */
00258           strncpy( my_config_path, optarg, MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00259           break ;
00260 
00261         case 'd':
00262           /* Detach or not detach ? */
00263           detach_flag = TRUE ;
00264           break ;
00265 
00266         case 'R':
00267           /* Shall we manage  RPCSEC_GSS ? */
00268           fprintf( stderr, "\n\nThe -R flag is deprecated, use this syntax in the configuration file instead:\n\n" ) ;
00269           fprintf( stderr, "NFS_KRB5\n" ) ;
00270           fprintf( stderr, "{\n" ) ;
00271           fprintf( stderr, "\tPrincipalName = nfs@<your_host> ;\n" ) ;
00272           fprintf( stderr, "\tKeytabPath = /etc/krb5.keytab ;\n" ) ;
00273           fprintf( stderr, "\tActive_krb5 = TRUE ;\n" ) ;
00274           fprintf( stderr, "}\n\n\n" ) ;
00275           exit( 1 ) ; 
00276           break ;
00277 
00278         case 'F':
00279           /* Flushes the data cache to the FSAL and purges the cache */ 
00280           my_nfs_start_info.flush_datacache_mode = TRUE ;
00281           my_nfs_start_info.flush_behaviour      = CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE ;
00282           my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads     = (unsigned int)atoi( optarg ) ;
00283           my_nfs_start_info.lw_mark_trigger      = FALSE ;
00284 
00285           if( my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads > NB_MAX_FLUSHER_THREAD )
00286                 my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads = NB_MAX_FLUSHER_THREAD ;
00287           break ;
00288 
00289         case 'S':
00290           /* Flushes the data cache to the FSAL, without purging the cache */
00291           my_nfs_start_info.flush_datacache_mode = TRUE ;
00292           my_nfs_start_info.flush_behaviour      = CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_SYNC_ONLY ;
00293           my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads     = (unsigned int)atoi( optarg ) ;
00294           my_nfs_start_info.lw_mark_trigger      = FALSE ;
00295 
00296           if( my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads > NB_MAX_FLUSHER_THREAD )
00297                 my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads = NB_MAX_FLUSHER_THREAD ;
00298           break ;
00299 
00300         case 'P':
00301           /* Flushes the data like '-F' until low water mark is reached, then just sync */
00302           my_nfs_start_info.flush_datacache_mode = TRUE ;
00303           my_nfs_start_info.flush_behaviour      = CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE ;
00304           my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads     = (unsigned int)atoi( optarg ) ;
00305           my_nfs_start_info.lw_mark_trigger      = TRUE ;
00306 
00307           if( my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads > NB_MAX_FLUSHER_THREAD )
00308                 my_nfs_start_info.nb_flush_threads = NB_MAX_FLUSHER_THREAD ;
00309           break ;
00310          
00311 
00312         case '?':
00313         case 'h':
00314         default:
00315           /* display the help */
00316           fprintf( stderr, usage, exec_name ) ;
00317           exit( 0 ) ;
00318           break ;
00319         }
00320     }
00321     
00322     
00323     /* initialize memory and logging */
00324     
00325     if ( nfs_prereq_init( exec_name, host_name, debug_level, log_path ) )
00326     {
00327         fprintf( stderr, "NFS MAIN: Error initializing NFSd prerequisites\n" );
00328         exit(1);
00329     }
00330     
00331     
00332     /* Start in background, if wanted */
00333     if( detach_flag )
00334     {
00335       /* Step 1: forking a service process */
00336       switch( son_pid = fork() )
00337         {
00338         case -1 :
00339           /* Fork failed */
00340           DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_FORK, errno ) ;
00341           DisplayLog( "Could nout start nfs daemon, exiting..." ) ;
00342           exit( 1 ) ;
00343           
00344         case 0:
00345           /* This code is within the son (that will actually work)
00346            * Let's make it the leader of its group of process */
00347           if( setsid() == -1 )
00348             {
00349               DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SETSID, errno ) ;
00350               DisplayLog( "Could nout start nfs daemon, exiting..." ) ;
00351               exit( 1 ) ;
00352             }
00353           break ;
00354 
00355         default:
00356           /* This code is within the father, it is useless, it must die */
00357           DisplayLog( "Starting a son of pid %d\n", son_pid ) ;
00358           exit( 0 ) ;
00359           break ;
00360         }
00361     }
00362     
00363     DisplayLog( ">>>>>>>>>> Starting GANESHA NFS Daemon on FSAL/%s <<<<<<<<<<", FSAL_GetFSName() ) ;
00364     
00365     /* Set the signal handler */
00366     memset( &act_sigusr1, 0, sizeof( act_sigusr1 ) ) ;
00367     act_sigusr1.sa_flags = 0 ;
00368     act_sigusr1.sa_handler = action_sigusr1 ;
00369     if( sigaction( SIGUSR1, &act_sigusr1, NULL ) == -1 )
00370     {
00371         DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SIGACTION, errno ) ;
00372         exit( 1 ) ;
00373     }
00374     else
00375         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Signal SIGUSR1 (force flush) is ready to be used" ) ;
00376         
00377     /* Set the signal handler */
00378     memset( &act_sigterm, 0, sizeof( act_sigterm ) ) ;
00379     act_sigterm.sa_flags = 0 ;
00380     act_sigterm.sa_handler = action_sigterm ;
00381     if( sigaction( SIGTERM, &act_sigterm, NULL ) == -1 
00382         || sigaction( SIGINT, &act_sigterm, NULL ) == -1  )
00383     {
00384         DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_SIGACTION, errno ) ;
00385         exit( 1 ) ;
00386     }
00387     else
00388         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Signals SIGTERM and SIGINT (daemon shutdown) are ready to be used" ) ;
00389         
00390     /* initialize default parameters */
00391     
00392     if( nfs_set_param_default( &nfs_param ) )
00393     {
00394         DisplayLog( "NFS MAIN: Error setting default parameters." );
00395         exit(1);
00396     }
00397         
00398     /* parse configuration file */
00399     
00400     if( nfs_set_param_from_conf( &nfs_param, &my_nfs_start_info, my_config_path ) )
00401     {
00402       DisplayLog( "NFS MAIN: Error parsing configuration file." ) ;
00403       exit(1);
00404     }
00405 
00406     /* check parameters consitency */
00407     
00408     if( nfs_check_param_consistency( &nfs_param ) )
00409     {
00410         DisplayLog( "NFS MAIN: Inconsistent parameters found" ) ;
00411         DisplayLog( "MAJOR WARNING: /!\\ | Bad Parameters could have significant impact on the daemon behavior" ) ;
00412         exit(1);
00413     }
00414     
00415     /* Everything seems to be OK! We can now start service threads */
00416     nfs_start( &nfs_param, &my_nfs_start_info );
00417     
00418     return 0;    
00419     
00420 }
